p.s: In my opinion a revive of a relationship depends on two factos: 1) it depends on how great the bond or connection between the two partners really is.
2) how big the time gap between the end of the relationship and the revive is, as it is normally for humans to lose feelings for somebody or something after a certain time.
If you look at Gatsby and Daisy one can see that espaciallyespecially Gatsby still has this extremextreme bond to Daisy, because he remembered the exact time when they have last seen each other.
In addition the exaggerated positivity of Gatsby, as well as his embarassmentembarrassment show that Gatsby still loves Daisy the same as before.
On the other hand Daisy didn't remember the exact time they have last seen each other, but she felt the same embarrassment as Gatsby during their encounter.
These facts indicate that Gatsby's bond to Daisy is way bigger than hers to him as he obviously didn't get over her which gets underlined by him being single.

Daisy on the other hand probably got over Gatsby as she primarily is married to Tom due to his wealth and secondarily being surprised in one of the first scenes where Jordan mentions Gatsby, shows that she didn't think about him before.

In conclusion to their situation one can say that on an emotional stage their chances of getting back together are quiet low, due to Daisy's missing empathieempathy and bond for Gatsby, but as Daisy just cares about wealth and status which her toxic marriage with Tom shows, she could get attracted by Gatsby's wealth and his dedication for her.
To summarize everything that has been stated so far, I would say that their chances for a revive of their past relationship are quiet low.

In comparison to a revival of a relationship in general one could say that the chances are equally low, but the normal reason for a break up is an emotional conflict, which was not the case with Gatsby and Daisy as they broke up because Gatsby left to the army.

In conclusion one can say that normally a revival of a past relationship is just possible if both parntners are still attracted or reattract to the partnerspartner's character, but in the case of Gatsby and Daisy, Gatsby is still attracted to Daisy's character, but Daisy would be attracted to him as well, if she wouldn't be seeking for status and wealth which overshadow her true emotions for Gatsby.
